dialogue.text: Oh, I can gush about Togarashi Town all day! It's been one of my go-to spots to spend my off days in for the past few years.
That place is even bigger than Enzync City! Funny that the 'town' is bigger than the city.
The title isn't a semantics issue this time. Togarashi Town used to just be a large town to the north of Enzync City a long time ago.
That was until this huge city expansion first planned for Enzync City got moved closer to Togarashi Town instead, thus it became part of the town.
Togarashi Town is split up into 3 main parts because of this.
On the Western side is Old Togarashi, where the original Togarashi Town still remains untouched. Stepping in there is like walking into a living time capsule.
They've kept up their traditions for so many years there. It's absolutely gorgeous to walk around in, though it's not a great place for tourists with most of it being residential.
Then if you head furthest up North, you'll be in New Togarashi. It's a modern marvel of a city, with skyscrapers, stores, sights, you name it!

I swear, you'll never get bored when you're there! There's always a bustling arcade or a trending hotspot glowing in your face to keep yourself occupied. The contrast between the two sections is honestly extreme.
That's where the third section comes in. Right in the entrance to Togarashi Town is Togarashi Central!
It's the converging point between Old and New Togarashi, so it's got a little bit of modern and a little bit of traditional mixed into one.
The huge speaker gate at the entrance was built to represent that fusion of styles.
The speaker gate is also a popular meetup spot for couples. You'll always find lovebirds of all ages flocked together around it.
It's such a nice spot to pass by. I always wondered... if I stood by it long enough, maybe I'd find my own true love.
I'd really hate to burst your bubble on that, but it's only existing couples that meet up around it usually.
I know... I just hope that it could be me holding hands with someone there one day...
Keep your chin up, Sunny. It'll be your time one day.
